result.execSummary:
The defendant Branden L Travelstead was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: ***Deft is ordered to provide a DNA sample prior being released from jail.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Branden L Travelstead

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Branden L Travelstead in court with attorney Chris Simonds for Kate Marie Simonds.  Defendant Branden L Travelstead in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
State has extended an offer.
Def requests this matter be set over to this afternoon.
State does not object.
BTC: Set matter over to this afternoon.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with victim store except for restitution purposes. Moble at 6840 Washington Ave.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Branden L Travelstead in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Branden L Travelstead in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
